intro: Neobartsia elongata, commonly known as the elongated bartsia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and wetlands. Its slender stems and small, opposite leaves are characteristic of the genus. Neobartsia elongata produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple, attracting various pollinators.
